phases.name: Client Onboarding
phases.description: The initial phase for establishing contact, gathering essential information, and setting the stage for the engagement.

stages.name: Introduction Call
stages.description: Initial meeting to align on key personnel and communication protocols.

steps.name: Introduce key players from the consulting and client teams.
Identify the Client's Primary Contact for the engagement.
Discuss and confirm who should receive planning updates, status reports, and final deliverables.
Schedule the official Audit Kick-Off call.

stages.name: Information Gathering
stages.description: Collecting preliminary documentation to understand the client's environment.

steps.name: Deliver the Client Business Questionnaire to gather critical information about the client organization's business objectives, environment, and preliminary audit scope.
Request key organizational charts, process documentation, and prior audit deliverables.

phases.name: Pre Kick-Off
phases.description: Internal planning and client coordination before the official start of the audit.

stages.name: Internal Planning & Scoping
stages.description: Developing the audit plan and initial request lists.

steps.name: Complete the internal Engagement Control and Requirements Profile based on the client questionnaire and initial discussions.
Develop the initial Information Request List (IRL) based on the defined scope including expected due dates.

stages.name: Client Coordination
stages.description: Aligning with the client on requests and preparing for the kick-off meeting.

steps.name: Deliver the draft IRL to the Client's Primary Contact to give them a heads-up on required evidence.
Schedule brief pre-kick-off touchpoint with the Client's Primary Contact and key client personnel as needed to assign owners to IRL items.
Finalize the Kick-Off presentation deck with the Client's Primary Contact.

phases.name: Audit Kick-Off
phases.description: The formal start of the engagement with all stakeholders.

stages.name: Kick-Off Meeting
stages.description: A formal meeting to align all stakeholders on the engagement's scope, timeline, and processes.

steps.name: Conduct the formal Kick-Off meeting with all relevant client stakeholders.
Present and confirm the final engagement scope, objectives, methodology, and timeline.
Explain the evidence/response collection process and timeframes for the engagement.
Reiterate the communication plan, including the cadence for status meetings and format for updates.
Answer any questions from the client team.

phases.name: Post Kick-Off
phases.description: Scheduling detailed follow-up meetings after the initial kick-off.

stages.name: Schedule SME meetings
stages.description: Arranging interviews and walkthroughs with subject matter experts.

steps.name: Schedule meetings for interviews, demos, walkthroughs etc with SME in key areas including: Change Management and BCP/DR.

phases.name: Fieldwork & Execution
phases.description: The core phase of evidence collection, testing, and analysis.

stages.name: Daily - Morning
stages.description: Morning routine for processing updates and setting the day's agenda.

steps.name: Process any new submissions (at least set to ‘pending’ to acknowledge receipt).
Address any inbound messages or questions.
Schedule any requested or needed discussions.
Send morning status summaries to Control / task Owners: any status updates on previously submitted responses, and summary of open items with due dates.

stages.name: Daily - Afternoon
stages.description: Afternoon activities focused on meetings and substantive testing.

steps.name: Hold SME and control owner meetings as scheduled.

Review Client Submissions and Perform testing of controls, systems, and processes according to the audit plan; documenting all test procedures, evidence reviewed, results, and preliminary observations in the tracker.

stages.name: Daily - Wrap-up
stages.description: End-of-day routine for final processing and summary reporting.

steps.name: Process any new submissions (at least set to ‘pending’ to acknowledge receipt).
Address any inbound messages or questions.
Schedule any requested or needed discussions.
Send daily wrap-up summaries to Auditor & Customer Primary Contact: Overview of fieldwork progress, approaching or missed deadlines, tracked issue updates, possible findings, etc.
Client submission of responses/evidence via tracker.

stages.name: Weekly
stages.description: Weekly recurring status meetings and reporting.

steps.name: Hold status meetings with the Client Primary Contact.
Provide weekly status report detailing: Completed tasks, Upcoming activities, Open IRL items, Identified risks or roadblocks.

phases.name: Finding Development & Validation
phases.description: Drafting, confirming, and getting management responses for all identified findings.

stages.name: Finding Development & Validation
stages.description: The process of formalizing and validating audit findings with stakeholders.

steps.name: Draft preliminary findings and observations based on testing results.
Hold validation sessions with control/process owners to confirm the factual accuracy of each finding.
Request formal management responses for each validated finding, to include a remediation plan and target completion date.

phases.name: Reporting & Deliverables
phases.description: Creating and delivering the final audit report.

stages.name: Draft Report Creation
stages.description: Consolidating findings into a draft report and performing internal review.

steps.name: Consolidate all validated findings, management responses, and supporting analysis into the draft audit report.
The report should include an executive summary, background, scope, methodology, and a detailed findings section.
Conduct an internal peer review of the draft report to ensure quality, clarity, and accuracy.

stages.name: Client Review & Finalization
stages.description: Working with the client to finalize the report.

steps.name: Deliver the draft report to the Client's Primary Contact for management review.
Schedule a meeting to walk through the draft report, discuss findings, and address any questions or concerns.
Incorporate any factual corrections or clarifications from the client and finalize the report.

stages.name: Final Report Delivery
stages.description: Formally delivering the final report and closing the engagement.

steps.name: Deliver the final, approved audit report to all designated stakeholders.
Conduct a formal Closing Meeting to present the final report, summarize key results, and discuss next steps.

phases.name: Engagement Wrap-Up & Closure
phases.description: Post-engagement follow-up and internal administrative closure.

stages.name: Post-Engagement Activities
stages.description: Following up with the client on remediation efforts.

steps.name: Schedule a follow-up (e.g., 3-6 months post-engagement) to check on the status of management's remediation efforts.
Remain available to provide clarification on findings as the client works on remediation.

stages.name: Internal Close-Out
stages.description: Finalizing all internal records and processes for the engagement.

steps.name: Archive all engagement workpapers, evidence, reports, and communications in the firm's records management system.
Conduct an internal project post-mortem to identify lessons learned and opportunities for process improvement.
Finalize and close out all engagement billing and administrative tasks.
